snippet: The government-backed mortgage financier said it made a profit in the first quarter and that it does not need additional bailout money — a first since the federal government took it over in 2008.
abstract: Fannie Mae, the government-backed mortgage financier, says it made a profit in the first quarter and that it does not need additional bailout money--a first since the federal government took it over in 2008; first-quarter profit was $2.7 billion, up from a $6.5 billion loss in the year-ago quarter.
lead_paragraph: The government-backed mortgage financier said it made a profit in the first quarter and that it does not need additional bailout money — a first since the federal government took it over in 2008.

headline.seo: Fannie Mae Profit Signals a Stabilizing Housing Market
headline.main: Fannie Mae Posts Profit; Seeks No Aid
headline.print_headline: Fannie Mae Posts Profit; Seeks No Aid
